Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of AI-Enhanced VR Training in Vascular Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted at a tertiary vascular surgery training center.

Participants.evidence: Participants were vascular surgery trainees meeting eligibility criteria.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received AI-enhanced VR training, while the control group underwent traditional training.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates AI-enhanced VR training as a solution.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was technical skill proficiency, measured over a 6-month period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the intervention and 100 to the control group, between January 2020 and June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis included 98 in the intervention group and 97 in the control group, using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group showed a significant improvement in technical skills (mean difference = 5.2, 95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were mild, with 3% in the intervention group and 1% in the control group experiencing minor side effects.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Supported by the National Institute of Health.
